fields.Video Description: This video was recorded by Plator Gashi at the Youth of European Nationalities conference in Tirana, Albania. Danish is spoken by over 5 million people, primarily in the Western European nation of Denmark, as well as in the Faroe Islands and Greenland, constituent territories of the Danish Kingdom. A Scandinavian language, Danish is related to other North Germanic mother tongues such as Icelandic, sharing a common genealogy descending from Old Norse, the lingua franca of medieval Viking peoples. Following the introduction of printed media into Europe in the 16th century, Danish speakers developed a formal literary standard, which is one of the European Union's 24 official languages today.
italki call to action: Get a free Danish lesson with italki: http://promos.italki.com/wikitongues_dan
Demographics: 5,380,000 in Denmark (ELDIA 2012). Population total all countries: 5,522,490.
YouTube License Statement: The speaker(s) featured herein have not explicitly agreed to distribute this video for reuse. For inquiries on licensing this video, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
fields.Geneaology: "[ Indo-European, Germanic, North, East Scandinavian, Danish-Swedish, Danish-Riksmal, Danish ]"
